intro: Euphrasia hirtella var. fennica, commonly known as the Fennoscandian eyebright, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to northern Europe and parts of Siberia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in woodland or heathland habitats. It is known for its medicinal properties, with historical use in traditional remedies for eye conditions. Its delicate appearance and specific ecological requirements make it a notable species in its native range.
